de.mrapp.android.validation

Class Constraints

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.validation.Constraints

  • public final class Constraints
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides factory methods, which allow to create various constraints.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <Type> Constraint<Type> conjunctive(Constraint<Type>... constraints)
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to combine multiple constraints in a conjunctive manner.
      static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsLetter()
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one letter.
      static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsNumber()
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one number.
      static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsSymbol()
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one symbol.
      static <Type> Constraint<Type> disjunctive(Constraint<Type>... constraints)
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to combine multiple constraints in a disjunctive manner.
      static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> minLength(int minLength)
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they have at least a specific length.
      static <Type> Constraint<Type> negate(Constraint<Type> constraint)
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to negate the result of an other constraint.
      static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> regex(java.util.regex.Pattern regex)
      Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if the match a certain regular expression.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • negate

        public static <Type> Constraint<Type> negate(Constraint<Type> constraint)
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to negate the result of an other constraint.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be verified
        Parameters:
        constraint - The constraint, whose result should be negated, as an instance of the type Constraint. The constraint may not be null
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • conjunctive

        @SafeVarargs
public static <Type> Constraint<Type> conjunctive(Constraint<Type>... constraints)
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to combine multiple constraints in a conjunctive manner. Only if all single constraints are satisfied, the resulting constraint will also be satisfied.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be verified
        Parameters:
        constraints - The single constraints, the constraint should consist of, as an array of the type Constraint. The constraints may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • disjunctive

        @SafeVarargs
public static <Type> Constraint<Type> disjunctive(Constraint<Type>... constraints)
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to combine multiple constraints in a disjunctive manner. If at least one constraint is satisfied, the resulting constraint will also be satisfied.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be verified
        Parameters:
        constraints - The single constraints, the constraint should consist of, as an array of the type Constraint. The constraints may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • regex

        public static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> regex(java.util.regex.Pattern regex)
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if the match a certain regular expression.
        Parameters:
        regex - The regular expression, which should be used to verify the texts, as an instance of the class Pattern. The regular expression may not be null
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • minLength

        public static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> minLength(int minLength)
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they have at least a specific length.
        Parameters:
        minLength - The minimum length a text must have as an Integer value. The minimum length must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • containsNumber

        public static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsNumber()
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one number.
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • containsLetter

        public static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsLetter()
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one letter.
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint

      • containsSymbol

        public static Constraint<java.lang.CharSequence> containsSymbol()
        Creates and returns a constraint, which allows to verify texts in order to check, if they contain at least one symbol. Symbols are considered to be all characters except lower and uppercase letters from A to Z and numbers.
        Returns:
        The constraint, which has been created, as an instance of the type Constraint
